Input files¶

This section describes the input file types accepted by MrBait.

Assembled genomes¶

MrBait only accepts genome assemblies formatted as FASTA. These can represent contigs, scaffolds, or entire chromosomes. According to the FASTA specifications, a sequence should begin with a header line, or short description (indicated by the “>” symbol), followed by a second line containing sequence data. For MrBait, it does not matter if the following lines are interleaved or on a single line, and any blank lines in the file will be ignored, as will any leading or trailing whitespace.

An example FASTA-formatted sequence is given below.

1
2
3
4
5
6
7
8
9
>chr1.scaffold1
ATAGCTCGGCTACGTGATCGCGTGCTC-ATGCTAGCGCTNNNNNNNNATGATTGCTTTT
TGTGTGTGCAAGCACTGCCGRGCTACGCGCTACTGCCRCCTAGTATGTGTGGCCGCTAC
TAGTCCGCGCTAGCTtTtagatctcgtggcgccgcgcgcgtcgcacgatcgtacgcgcc
>chr1.scaffold2
ATCGTGCTGCGGCGCTGCCTCAGC…
